XProductStoreParm.description: Method of verying the addres (in addition to standard validation).Valid values are NONE, PCA, MELISSA_DATA
Default view size
The URL location of the help files
The maximum number of characters to display in a Tooltip within the Admin Module
Default max view size
Determines if COD (Cash on Delivery) is an option for checkout. This is used extensively in the Indian marketplace.
Determines if EBS is an acceptable form of payment during the Check Out process.
Determines if Google Checkout is an acceptable for of payment during the Check Out process.
Determines if PayPal is an acceptable form of payment during the Check Out process.
Defines whether a customer can checkout as a Guest, without having to register.
The default Shipping Charge ID that will be used in the View Cart. This will allow for an estimation of shipping to be computed. Leave blank if no shipping charge defaults should be in the cart.
If set to TRUE then prompt for the Verification information. If not true then this information is not required for credit card authentication

A comma separated list of Cookies that should be read for possible content. The Order Confirmation will use the content of each cookie, if it exists, to store additional attributes for the Order. Typically used for Affiliate Tracking.
The link from the Continue-Shopping button. Values are HOMEPAGE, PDP or PLP
Defines whether a customer is given a delivery option (with associated shipping charges)
Ability to have customers maintain the various checkout details for use in a future purchase

TRUE or FALSE flag value to indicate if all manual promo-codes are mutually exclusive. TRUE: only ONE promo-code will be allowed to be applied to the Order. FALSE: multiple promo-codes are allowed to be applied to the Order.

For implementation using BIGFISH as the Inventory Method. A comma separated list of Shipping Cost Estimate IDs used to suppress certain shipping options if BF-INVENTORY-WHS is equal or less than zero for any cart items
Defines whether the Single-Page checkout page is offered by default
Defines whether a 'Pickup-In-Store' offers a credit card payment
Defines whether a 'Pickup-In-Store' REQUIRES payment by credit card before the order is accepted
Defines whether the 'Pickup-in-Store' is an option during the check-out work flow
This will suppress the Sales-Tax line during the checkout if the tax is zero. Used for UK clients where the VAT is included in the purchase price.

On the CLP (Category Listing Page) a value of TRUE will hide all standard sub-categories on the assumption that Content Spots will be displayed in order to manage the customer experience on every CLP.
The client's default country
If the client supports Multi-countries, this is the list of coutries supported.
Does this client support multiple coutries. Value of TRUE or FALSE
Country currency UOM.
The time in hours to wait before sending the Abandoned Cart email. Set to 0 to disable the Abandoned Cart email.
The number of times to send the Abandoned Cart email, reset if the customer purchases. Set to 0 to disable the Abandoned Cart email.
Path and image location, referenced in email-templates
Client name, referenced in email-templates
Client Email address, referenced in email-templates
Client Telephone number, referenced in email-templates
Displayed URL, referenced in email-templates
URL to visit, referenced in email-templates
Default font-family for all emails
Send email for product review after day ? shipped.
HTML Table font size, referenced in email-templates
HTML Table color, referenced in email-templates
HTML Table size, referenced in email-templates
Display categories as a facet group on the PLP page true or false
If the customer clicks a value in this Facet Group then the system will attempt to find a matching Variant
Control the number of decimal places to be displayed in the listed prices
Determines whether the facets show the number of items in parenthesis
Max Number of facet values to show
Number of facet values to show; see less/More
Sub directory reference that indicates where Incoming files should be moved if errors are found during processing.
Client to Bigfish Incoming Order Status File, indicates the default URL or Directory location to look for files for processing.
Client to Bigfish Incoming Product File, indicates the default URL or Directory location to look for files for processing.
Client to Bigfish Incoming Rating File, indicates the default URL or Directory location to look for files for processing.
Client to Bigfish Incoming Store File, indicates the default URL or Directory location to look for files for processing.
Sub directory reference that indicates where Incoming files should be moved after successful processing.
Bigfish to Client Outgoing Contact-Us File, indicates the prefix of the actual file name, will be suffixed with date-time stamp for uniqueness.
Bigfish to Client Outgoing Contact-Us File, indicates the default URL or Directory location to place newly created files.
Bigfish to Client Outgoing Customer File, indicates the prefix of the actual file name, will be suffixed with date-time stamp for uniqueness.
Bigfish to Client Outgoing Customer File, indicates the default URL or Directory location to place newly created files.
Bigfish to Client Outgoing Order File, indicates the prefix of the actual file name, will be suffixed with date-time stamp for uniqueness.
Bigfish to Client Outgoing Order File, indicates the default URL or Directory location to place newly created files.
Bigfish to Client Outgoing Request-Catalog File, indicates the prefix of the actual file name, will be suffixed with date-time stamp for uniqueness.
Bigfish to Client Outgoing Request-Catalog File, indicates the default URL or Directory location to place newly created files.
This defines how Addresses are formatted within both the eCommerce and Admin modules.
This defines how currency is displayed within both the eCommerce and Admin modules.
This defines how dates are displayed within both the eCommerce and Admin modules. CASE SENSITIVE. dd=Day, MM=Month yy=Year hh=Hour mm=Minute ss=Second.
This defines how date time are displayed within both the eCommerce and Admin modules. CASE SENSITIVE. dd=Day, MM=Month yy=Year hh=Hour mm=Minute ss=Second.
This defines how Telephone Numbers are formatted within both the eCommerce and Admin modules.
Google analytics account number
Google analytics site verification
Request Url for Getting Geo Point Input as Address
Request Url Key for Showing Google Map Input as Geo Point(Lat,Long)
Request Url for Showing Google Map Input as Geo Point(Lat,Long)
Height of store locator map
Width of store locator map
Initial zoom level of display map
The number of Store matches to display (within the Radius)
Height of store locator map when used in select a store
Width of store locator map when used in select a store
The Miles/Kilometers to use as the radius when matching
Store Locator unit of measure. Values allowed are Miles or Kilometers.
A general system parameter that defines the secure primary host name of the application. Typically used in email or content spots.
A general system parameter that defines the primary host name of the application. Typically used in email or content spots.

If the current inventory is greater than or equal to this value then the Product is considered to be In-Stock.
The method used for tracking inventory: NONE: Inventory is not relevant to this implementation OFBIZ: use standard OFBiz inventory. Facility, reservations, ATP, QOH BIGFISH: simple inventory value
If the current inventory is less than or equal to this value then the Product is considered to be Out-of-Stock.
Defines whether the retailer site supports the View-Cart drop-down light box functionality
The time, in milliseconds, that the site will wait before displaying the Light Box
Indicates the Directory location where the Melissa Canada db is configured for checking the Canadian address.
Indicates the Directory location where the Melissa US db is configured for checking the US address.
HTTP url for address verification. Default value is https://addresscheck.melissadata.net/v2/REST/Service.svc/doAddressCheck
A current license string is required to use the functionality of locally installed Melissa address tool. Use 'DEMO' string as license in demo mode.
Registered customer Id for web data verification

Melissa provides the two types of services for address verification. First install the Melissa address tool locally and second send HTTP request for verification. Possible values are HTTP or FILEPATH.

XProductStoreParm.parmValue: ORDER_SENT, ORDER_PROCESSING, ORDER_APPROVED, ORDER_HOLD, ORDER_COMPLETED, ORDER_REJECTED, ORDER_CANCELLED
XProductStoreParm.description: A comma separated list of Order Status IDs that should be included in the Dashboard sales numbers. Can include ORDER_CREATED, ORDER_SENT, ORDER_PROCESSING, ORDER_APPROVED, ORDER_HOLD, ORDER_COMPLETED, ORDER_REJECTED, ORDER_CANCELLED

A comma separated list of Order Status IDs that should be included in the Order Export process. Can include ORDER_CREATED, ORDER_SENT, ORDER_PROCESSING, ORDER_APPROVED, ORDER_HOLD, ORDER_COMPLETED, ORDER_REJECTED, ORDER_CANCELLED

XProductStoreParm.parmValue: ORDER_CREATED, ORDER_SENT, ORDER_PROCESSING, ORDER_APPROVED, ORDER_HOLD, ORDER_COMPLETED, ORDER_REJECTED, ORDER_CANCELLED
XProductStoreParm.description: A comma separated list of Order Status IDs that should be used on the Order List screen. ORDER_CREATED, ORDER_SENT, ORDER_PROCESSING, ORDER_APPROVED, ORDER_HOLD, ORDER_COMPLETED, ORDER_REJECTED, ORDER_CANCELLED
Request url application number.
Request Url Key for intracting with PCA product
Request url for link PCA CSS
Request url for find address
TRUE or FALSE. This will define if there is a special scroller component implemented for the set of alternate images
The number of images that should be scrolled up or down when the arrow is clicked.
TRUE or FALSE. A value of TRUE will display a Vertical scroller. A value of FALSE will display a Horizontal scroller.

This is the FACET GROUP that will be used for matching in the PDP. Examples: customer clicks on the Blue Swatch, system needs to match on Color-Group facet to show matching you-may-also-like products.
This is the FACET GROUP that may have variant 'swatches' images on the PLP. For example, if this parameter is set to COLOR then the PDP will offer the 'color swatches'as a selector.
TRUE or FALSE flag value to indicate zoom activation on PDP image
The maximum allowed quantity that can be ordered on the PDP
The minimum allowed quantity that can be ordered on the PDP
The number of recently-viewed-products that are to be displayed within the PDP

XProductStoreParm.parmValue: HIGHEST_RATING, BEST_SELLING, MOST_POPULAR, NAME_ASCENDING, MOST_VIEWED, NAME_DESCENDING, HIGHEST_PRICE, LOWEST_PRICE
XProductStoreParm.description: A comma separated list of available Sort options on the PLP. Valid values can contain one, more or all of the following: HIGHEST_RATING, BEST_SELLING, MOST_POPULAR, NAME_ASCENDING, NAME_DESCENDING, HIGHEST_PRICE, MOST_VIEWED, LOWEST_PRICE
Controls the default sequence used on all PLP pages. Valid values are: HIGHEST_RATING, BEST_SELLING, MOST_POPULAR, NAME_ASCENDING, NAME_DESCENDING, MOST_VIEWED, HIGHEST_PRICE, LOWEST_PRICE
This is the FACET GROUP that will be used for matching in the PLP. Example: customer clicks on Color=Blue facet, system needs to match on Color-Group facet to show similar products.
This is the FACET GROUP that will used to control the Sticky link from the PLP Variant to the PDP Variant

This is the FACET GROUP that may have variant 'swatch' images on the PLP. For example, if this parameter is set to COLOR, and COLOR=Red is clicked on the Facets, then the PDP processing will look for images from the variant product Color=Red.
The number of items that should appear per page in the PLP.
A comma separated list of which Good Identification Type IDs to include in the Admin Product detail screen.
Only show LIST Price if the monetary saving is greater than or equal to this setting
Only show PCT savings if the pct savings is greater than or equal to this setting
Display quick view on the PLP page for each product.
The time, in milliseconds, that the site will wait before displaying the Quick Look icon
TRUE or FALSE. Indicates if the Quicklook implementation is using the inline image zoom feature.
Used to identify the Reevoo service when retrieving the CSV file from Reevoo for Product ratings updates.
Request Url for showing REEVOO mark badge
Used to identify the file destination when retrieving the CSV file from Reevoo for Product ratings updates.
Request Url for instantiate the REEVOO mark processing
Used for authentication purposes when retrieving the CSV file from Reevoo for Product ratings updates.
Display Reevoo mark on the PLP page true or false
Track reference for communicate with REEVOO
Used for authentication purposes when retrieving the CSV file from Reevoo for Product ratings updates.
Password Strength, specifies the minimum number of total characters.
Password Strength, specifies the minimum number of numeric digits.
Password Strength, specifies the minimum of uppercase characters.
TRUE indicates that the customer does NOT have to be logged in as a registered user. FALSE will force a login or registration
This defines whether Ratings and Reviews will be automatically approved. Setting this value to FALSE requires your approval of each Review posted. Approval is done in the Admin Module.
The maximum number of characters allowed for a review. Zero indicates that a review may have unlimited characters.
Determines if reviews are active and which service is implemented. NONE indicates no reviews. BIGFISH indicates standard BF Reviews. REEVOO indicates the Reevoo service.
The minimum number of characters allowed for a review. Zero indicates that a review may be left blank.
This is a specific review parameter to define whether BigFish sends out the email notification 'n' days after the Order has Shipped (defined by EMAIL_REVIEW_SHP_DYS).
Display Customer Ratings on the PLP page true or false.
Default text for site search entry text box
The comma separated list of Facet Groups that should be included after a Site Search.

XProductStoreParm.parmValue: Please enter one or more keywords to search...
XProductStoreParm.description: Site search no entry error message
Value for the Meta DESCRIPTION tag for the Home Page
Value for the Meta KEYWORDS tag for the Home Page
Value for the H1 tag for the Home Page
Value for the TITLE tag for the Home Page
Length of Meta DESCRIPTION tag. Will truncate to include a full word.
Length of Meta KEY tag. Will truncate to include a full word.
General name of the Store to be used in all TITLE tags except the Home Page. This will supplement other information that is used to derive the TITLE tag.
Parameter to define whether the SEO_GENERAL_TITLE is used as PREFIX or SUFFIX when building TITLE tags
Simple TRUE or FALSE value that will determine if the Built by Salmon LLC link will be displayed
Sitemap starting URL for Category List Pages
Sitemap starting URL for Product Detail Pages
Sitemap starting URL for Product List Pages
Sitemap starting URL for Static Pages
